chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw Or Discharge Bodily Fluids at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA during term of probation.  If revoked out of porison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC.  Balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at $0.
Full time work, school or a combination.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and voting.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No illegal drugs and no alcohol.
No contact with Burlington Coat Factory or Dollar Tree.
No further violatoins of the law.

Cooperate with agent.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

charges.descr: Throw Or Discharge Bodily Fluids  at Public Safety Worker

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1, 2, 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charges dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

As to Count 4: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
As to Count 4:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 years, concurrent to 21CF4285, credit for 105 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 1.5 years, the term of extended supervision is 2 years. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 2 years.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with Burlington Coat Factory or Dollar Tree. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Restitution set at $0. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. If revoked, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in court with Attorney Megan Kaldunski; both appear by video.  Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.    This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dollar Tree

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
